contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox badminton player | name = Eng Hian | image = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1977|05|17}} | birth_place = | height = | weight = | event = Men's doubles | highest_ranking = | date_of_highest_ranking = | current_ranking = | date_of_current_ranking = | country = {{INA}} | coach = | handedness = Right | best_result = | bwf_id = 8011 }} '''Eng Hian''' ({{zh|s=徐永贤|t=徐永賢|p=Xú Yǒngxián}}; born May 17, 1977) is a [[Chinese Indonesian]] male [[badminton]] player. A men's doubles specialist, he won major international tournaments, most of them in partnership with [[Flandy Limpele]], between 1999 and 2006. They earned a bronze medal in men's doubles at the [[badminton at the 2004 Summer Olympics|2004 Olympics in Athens]]. Their victories included the [[Korea Open (badminton)|Korea]] (1999), [[Denmark Open (badminton)|Denmark]] (2000), [[Singapore Open (badminton)|Singapore]] (2002), and [[Japan Open (badminton)|Japan]] Opens, and the [[Copenhagen Masters]] in 2000 and 2004. They were runners-up at the prestigious [[All England Open Badminton Championships|All-England Championships]] in 2002. Hian won the [[Dutch Open (badminton)|Dutch Open]] with [[Rian Sukmawan]] in 2006. ==2004 Olympics== Hian competed in [[badminton at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] in men's doubles with partner [[Flandy Limpele]]. They had a bye in the first round and defeated [[Anthony Clark (badminton)|Anthony Clark]] and [[Nathan Robertson]] of [[United Kingdom|Great Britain]] in the second. In the quarterfinals, Hian and Limpele beat [[Yim Bang-eun]] and [[Kim Yong-hyun]] of [[South Korea|Korea]] 15-1, 15-10. They lost the semifinal to [[Kim Dong-moon]] and [[Ha Tae-kwon]], also of Korea, 15-8, 15-2 but won the match against [[Jens Eriksen]] and [[Martin Lundgaard Hansen]] of [[Denmark]] 15-13, 15-7 to finish with the [[bronze medal]]. ==External links== *[http://www.internationalbadminton.org/playerinfo.asp?playerid=8011 BWF Player Profile] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Eng, Hian | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Badminton player | DATE OF BIRTH =May 17, 1977 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Eng, Hian}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Badminton players at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Indonesian badminton players]] [[Category:Olympic badminton players of Indonesia]] [[Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Indonesia]] [[Category:Olympic medalists in badminton]] {{Indonesia-badminton-bio-stub}} {{indonesia-Olympic-medalist-stub}}
